name: I Flew in a HARVARD! Saskatchewan Aviation Museum
description:
This flight was made possible by the Saskatchewan Aviation Museum! Find out more about them and their work at: https://saskaviation.ca

The North American T-6 Texan, known in British Commonwealth nations as the “Harvard”, is a two seat trainer aircraft that was developed in the late 1930s. It provided a hugely critical role in training pilots during World War II, with nearly 20,000  airplanes built for the American and British Commonwealth air forces.

See what it's like flying in the iconic North American Harvard in 2022!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Operator: Saskatchewan Aviation Museum 
Aircraft: North American Harvard Mk IV
Seat: Rear 
Livery: RCAF Yellow
Engines: 1x Pratt & Whitney R-1340-AN-1
Registration: CF-WXY
Route: Saskatoon (YXE) - Saskatoon (YXE)
Callsign: Harvard Whiskey X-ray Yankee
Runway used: 09
Date filmed: May 2022
